basics.name: Mason Springfield
basics.label: Mathematician
basics.summary: A mathematician from Texas with special interest in number theory, analysis, and special functions.

work.name: Department of Mathematics and Statistics, Texas Tech University
work.summary: Teaching at Texas Tech University. Instructor of record for several courses, along with graduate research
highlights: Fall 2023; TTU Calculus II with Applications (Online, Instructor of Record)
Spring 2023; TTU Higher Mathematics for Engineers and Scientists I (In-Person, Instructor of Record)
Fall 2022; TTU Calculus I with Applications (In-Person, Instructor of Record)
Spring 2022; TTU Introductory Mathematical Analysis II (In-Person, Instructor of Record)
Fall 2021; TTU Introductory Mathematical Analysis II (In-Person, Instructor of Record)

courses: The number of transitive subtournaments of k-th power Paley digraphs and improved lower bounds for Ramsey numbers
Preliminary Exam Fields: Real Analysis, Complex Analysis, Algebra

awards.title: Doctoral Dissertation Completion Fellowship
awards.summary: Awarded to graduate students to aid them in the completion of their doctoral dissertations.

awards.title: Distinguished Graduate Student Assitantship
awards.summary: Given to graduate students who show promise in research. Received from listed date through Spring of 2024.

awards.title: President's List
awards.summary: Given to students with exceptional accademic achievement. Received from listed date through Spring 2020.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Given to students with exceptional accademic achievement. This award was superseded by 'President's List'.

publications.name: Transitive subtournaments of k-th power Paley digraphs and improved lower bounds for Ramsey numbers (with D. McCarthy)
Orbits of Finite Field Hypergeometric Functions and Complete Subgraphs of Generalized Paley Graphs (with D. McCarthy)

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
